page.title: 11The Riverside "Mermaid".
page.content: The inn was built approximately 135 years ago and we believe that part of the premises was a brewery for many years. During the Second World War, members of the Home Guard were stationed in an outbuilding to guard the neighbouring bridge and river in case of invasion. Today the "Mermaid" is an inn and we have several letting rooms and two bars where we sell a selection of beers and lagers. Our beer comes mainly from Nottingham and is delivered by the kilderkin (18 gallons) or by barrel (36 gallons). We also have a restaurant and diners come for many a mile for one of our 'Mermaid' steaks. The licensee is Mr. Glen Miller.
